thread.title: COMMUNITY NOTES: AVIATION GROUP TO MEET, MORE
thread.title_full: COMMUNITY NOTES: AVIATION GROUP TO MEET, MORE - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: COMMUNITY NOTES: AVIATION GROUP TO MEET, MORE
text:
Published: Oct. 15, 2015 12:22 p.m. COMMUNITY NOTES: AVIATION GROUP TO MEET, MORE Print Photo Share Pin It 1 of 2 More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Left to right, Jacqueline Noone, Angala Barkley-Devine, Nicholas Nieblas and Chantel Cagle star in “Fond Farewell.” , COURTESY OF ANNETTE TRINGHAM Related article » Altura Credit Union makes donation CORONA – The Corona-Norco Settlement House recently received a $5,000 donation from Altura Credit Union as part of its year-long #AlturaCares campaign.
The nonprofit Settlement House provides emergency food, clothing, shelter and other resources for low-income individuals and families in Corona and Norco. It was founded in 1912.
– Staff report
Dinner theater coming to the Pass BEAUMONT – Catch A Star Theatrical Players will present a murder mystery dinner theater, “Fond Farewell,” at 6:30 p.m. Oct. 24 and Nov. 7 and 5 p.m. Nov. 1 at the Beaumont Women’s Community Center, 306 E. Sixth St. The cost is $35 per person.
The show stars Nicholas Nieblas, Dennis Johnson, Jason Vangilder, Andrew Horzen, Alejandra Juarez, Jacqueline Noone, Angala Barkley-Devine, Chantel Cagle, Rachael Johnson and Emily Isaak. It is directed by Ralph Griffey.
Reservations are required.
Information: 951-315-4253 or castplayers.org
– Staff report
Aviation group to meet RIVERSIDE – A trip to the Paris Air Show is the topic of the Inland Empire Aviation Roundtable meeting 7 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21 at the March Field Air Museum, 22550 Van Buren Blvd., Riverside.
The summer sojourn included several World War II museums and historic sites in England and France.
The meeting is open to the public.
Information: 951-902-5949
– Staff report
Council members to hold coffee klatch REDLANDS – Redlands City Councilmen Jon Harrison and Paul Barich will meet with the public for coffee 9 to 10:30 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 17 at Stell Coffee & Tea Co., 1580 Barton Road, Suite A, Redlands. Community members are invited to talk with the council members.
The get-together is part of the city’s Coffee with the Council series.
– Staff report
Martha Green to emcee charity event REGION – The Big Hearts for Little Hearts Loma Linda Guild will host its annual Cooking School, Holiday Tradition Dishes for Wishes Wednesday, Oct. 21 at the National Orange Show Events Center in San Bernardino.
Mistress of Ceremonies Martha Green will help local celebrity chefs prepare gourmet entrees. Proceeds benefit the NICU department at Loma Linda University Children’s Hospital.
A shopping boutique will open at 5:30 p.m., with the program to follow an hour later.
Tickets are $65 per person or $650 for a table of ten. Guests may register online at lluh.org/dishes .
– Staff report
